name: Diverticular Abscess with Fistula Formation
chief_complaint: I've had persistent left lower abdominal pain and fever for the past week, and now I notice pus in my stool.
physical_findings: palpable mass in left lower quadrant
treatment: surgical resection if recurrent or complicated
prognosis: Good with proper treatment, but risk of recurrence if underlying diverticular disease isn't managed
description: A complication of diverticulitis where a localized abscess forms and erodes into adjacent structures, creating an abnormal connection (fistula). Most commonly forms colovesical or colovaginal fistulas.
